text: my colleague gretchen morgenson and i
are finishing up an article that will
run in tomorrow's paper that focuses on
Fabrice tore the single person from
goldman sachs who's been named in a case
related to the financial crisis indeed
the only person from all of Wall Street
who has been named in a case related to
the sales of those complex mortgage
securities that put our markets at such
perilous risk LaBrie's was very involved
in designing and selling a mortgage
security called abacus 2007a see one it
was a mortgage security that was put
together right as the financial crisis
was just beginning and it's a mortgage
security that lost a ton of money for
investors it was designed in part
according to the SEC with input from a
hedge fund manager who was short on
housing he had a negative view and what
the SEC said was that fabrice and
Goldman Sachs should have disclosed to
other investors that there was this
involvement of this short seller in the
design some people find it odd that this
young guy he was 28 when these events
occurred in 2007 is the only person
named in this case in fact there are
some former Goldman employees that I
have spoken with over quite a while and
the way one of them put it to me was
that he would never go to fabrice if he
had questions about those mortgage
securities he would go to someone else
who worked above febreze someone named
Jonathan Eagle fabrice also worked
closely with lawyers at Goldman Sachs
with a former ratings analyst and it was
very much a collaborative effort our
reporting has shown so that raises
questions you know when you work on a
team on a collaborative effort how do
you end up in a case all by yourself
you
